tasks.title: Audit ROADMAP.md against current progress
tasks.description: Before shipping more features, double-check that Phase 0 checklists describe the state of the repo today and capture any gaps.
tasks.prompt: Start by reading ROADMAP.md, README.md, and logs/progress.log. Inspect every Phase 0 task (Sections 0.1–0.3) and verify whether the checkboxes reflect the actual implementation status in the repo. Update ROADMAP.md with accurate checkmarks or notes, cite concrete files/commits when confirming work, and highlight any regressions or missing deliverables. Summarize what changed in logs/progress.log and queue follow-up prompts or Human Tasks if blockers remain.
tasks.notes: Phase 0 checklists audited, discrepancies logged, and follow-up human task filed for the aux display before Phase 0.3 shipped.

tasks.title: Plan the next actionable Nightshift tasks
tasks.description: Translate the latest ROADMAP audit into concrete prompts so the queue stays full of high-priority work.
tasks.prompt: Re-read ROADMAP.md (with the latest updates) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Based on the audit findings, define the next set of prompts Nightshift should tackle, update docs/upgrade_plan.json with those tasks (including priorities), and enqueue the first batch so the queue keeps moving. Document the new prompt IDs in logs/progress.log, ensure each prompt instructs future agents to re-read ROADMAP.md, and create follow-up prompts or Human Tasks wherever necessary.

tasks.title: Draft a short-term Nightshift execution plan
tasks.description: Clarify the next couple of high-impact deliverables and ensure the queue contains verified prompts that carry the current planning guidance forward.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md, roadmap_updates.md, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and logs/progress.log so you are working from the latest priorities. Summarize the most urgent roadmap themes, then draft a short-term (next 2–3 prompts) execution plan that cites the relevant roadmap sections and gaps. Update docs/upgrade_plan.json with the concrete follow-up prompts (including priorities and the recursion instructions about reading the planning docs, verifying queue additions, and carrying those instructions forward). Queue at least the first prompt from that plan, verify every queued prompt appears in both data/prompts.json and logs/progress.log, and record the prompt IDs plus verification evidence in logs/progress.log and your final response. Ensure each new prompt explicitly tells its assignee to re-read the planning docs, confirm any follow-up tasks they queue are persisted in both places, and to propagate those directions recursively before marking this task complete.

tasks.title: Stage control-plane credential bundle for pairing
tasks.description: Operators need Cloudflare tunnel certs, nghtshft.ai API keys, and Monday tokens ready before the pairing workflow can ship.
tasks.prompt: Before provisioning secrets, re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 0.4/1.4), roadmap_updates.md §§1-2, and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Gather or refresh the Cloudflare tunnel credentials, nghtshft.ai control-plane API tokens, and Monday sandbox tokens the pairing bootstrap will request; store them in the operator vault and the ~/.config/systemd env files Nightshift loads. Any prompt or Human Task you queue must appear in both data/prompts.json (or an /api/prompts response) and logs/progress.log—record each ID plus the verification evidence (file path + timestamp) inside logs/progress.log and in your final response, and make sure every follow-up inherits this re-read + verification requirement before work begins.
tasks.notes: Human Task: ops gather control-plane + tunnel credentials so pairing can proceed.

tasks.title: Bootstrap the control-plane pairing and agent identity flow
tasks.description: Implement the ROADMAP Phase 0.4 / 1.4 requirements so every Nightshift instance bootstraps from the nghtshft.ai control plane with a canonical agent identity.
tasks.prompt: Before touching code, re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 0.4 + 1.4), roadmap_updates.md §§1-2, and docs/upgrade_plan.json so you inherit the latest constraints. Implement the nghtshft.ai control-plane pairing flow end-to-end: define config/agent_identity.yml, emit the pairing-code UI/log experience that blocks startup until POST /register-agent succeeds, fetch + persist the identity/tunnel bundle via GET /agent/:id/config, and surface the metadata inside the queue header and environment directory with operator docs + smoke tests. Any prompt or Human Task you queue while doing this must be verified in both data/prompts.json (or /api/prompts) and logs/progress.log—record each ID plus the verification evidence (file path + timestamp) inside logs/progress.log and your final response, and require every follow-up you spawn to repeat this re-read + verification checklist before executing.
tasks.notes: Delivered agent identity manager, pairing code UX/logging, /register-agent handler, config/agent_identity.yml template, GET /agent/:id/config sync, and operator smoke tests.

tasks.title: Wire Monday.com prompts + blocker sync into Nightshift
tasks.description: Kick off the Phase 2.5 PM integration so Monday boards become first-class prompt sources with bi-directional status + blocker sync.
tasks.prompt: Re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.5), roadmap_updates.md §3, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and the newest logs/progress.log entries describing PM sync expectations. Implement the first Monday integration slice: model data/pm_integrations.json, build the daemon/webhook that turns assigned Monday items into queue prompts, mirror status/comments/environment links back to Monday, and sync Human Tasks bi-directionally. While doing this, verify every prompt or Human Task you queue appears in both data/prompts.json (or /api/prompts) and logs/progress.log, record the IDs plus verification evidence (file path + timestamp) inside logs/progress.log and your final response, and ensure follow-up work keeps re-reading these planning docs and propagates the verification checklist before running.

tasks.title: Provision Monday sandbox board + API access
tasks.description: Operators must supply the Monday board ID, column mappings, webhook URL, and API token before the integration daemon can run.
tasks.prompt: Before granting access, re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.5), roadmap_updates.md §3, and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Create or select a Monday sandbox board for Nightshift, document the item/column IDs that map to prompt metadata, generate an API token + webhook target, and place the credentials in the operator vault plus Nightshift secret files. Any prompt or Human Task you create while doing this must show up in both data/prompts.json (or the /api/prompts response) and logs/progress.log; record the IDs and verification evidence (file path + timestamp) inside logs/progress.log and your final response, and propagate these planning/verification steps to all follow-ups.
tasks.notes: Human Task: coordinate Monday API creds + board metadata.

tasks.title: Guarantee FIFO queue observability across UI + logs
tasks.description: Finalize the queue ordering/visibility story so operators can trust the Task Queue state after the workspace layout changes.
tasks.prompt: Begin by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.4 queue watchlist), roadmap_updates.md §§4-5, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and the queue regression entries in logs/progress.log so you understand the drift. Build the watchdog that confirms PromptStore FIFO ordering, extends /api/health + the frontend status widgets with per-status counts/ages, and logs explicit queue verification records (IDs, timestamps, evidence paths) whenever prompts are enqueued. Every prompt or Human Task you add while doing this must be double-checked in data/prompts.json (or /api/prompts) and logs/progress.log; record the IDs plus verification evidence (file path + timestamp) inside logs/progress.log and your final response, and propagate this planning/verification requirement to any follow-ups you spawn.

tasks.title: Document the FIFO queue audit playbook
tasks.description: Operators need a repeatable checklist to prove queue ordering and capture evidence whenever regressions appear.
tasks.prompt: Re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.4 watchlist), roadmap_updates.md §§4-5, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and the latest queue drift entries in logs/progress.log. Turn the instrumentation from queue-metrics-watchdog into a documented playbook: CLI/API steps to capture FIFO evidence, how to log verification snapshots, and how to escalate anomalies back into prompts or Human Tasks. Every prompt or Human Task you add while writing this playbook must appear in both data/prompts.json (or /api/prompts) and logs/progress.log; record the IDs plus verification evidence (file path + timestamp) in logs/progress.log and your final response, and ensure all follow-up work propagates these re-read + verification requirements.
tasks.notes: Prompt: produce the operator runbook once instrumentation is available.

tasks.title: Expose richer queue metrics across the stack
tasks.description: Return per-status counts, oldest/newest timestamps, and rolling duration stats so the UI can visualize queue health trends.
tasks.prompt: Enhance the backend /api/health endpoint to surface queue metrics (counts per status, pending/running identifiers, and oldest/newest timestamps) and update the frontend health card to chart those stats and flag stalls.

tasks.title: Ship a CLI to inspect prompt logs quickly
tasks.description: Operators often need to tail the last Codex attempt; provide a helper script to fetch + stream prompt logs without digging through files.
tasks.prompt: Add a scripts/tail_prompt_log.py helper that lists prompts, accepts a prompt id, and tails its log (with optional follow mode) so operators can debug Codex runs from SSH.

tasks.title: Add filters and search to the queue UI
tasks.description: Let users filter prompts by status/project/text and search the backlog without scrolling through hundreds of entries.
tasks.prompt: Update the Vue/Vuetify frontend queue panel to support filtering by status, project, and free-text search, while persisting the last-used filters in localStorage.

tasks.title: Polish the project/environment directory UX
tasks.description: Phase 2.4 shipped the first pass of the new registry cards; follow up with advanced filters, export controls, and tighter layout options.
tasks.prompt: Re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.4) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Extend the Vue/Vuetify project/environment directory so operators can toggle columns, pin favourite environments, and export the current registry view as CSV. Document the UX updates and add regression tests for the new behaviours.

tasks.title: Add per-project permissions to the environment directory
tasks.description: The new registry cards currently assume a single operator role; add the groundwork for scoping or hiding environments/projects based on user permissions.
tasks.prompt: Re-read ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.4) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Design and implement a permissions model that lets the backend/UI restrict which projects/environments each user can see, update the APIs accordingly, and document the operator workflow. Queue Human Tasks for any manual credential work that remains.

tasks.title: Automate prompt log retention + archiving
tasks.description: Large prompt histories fill the SD card; add a retention policy that archives or prunes log files + prompt records after configurable thresholds.
tasks.prompt: Implement a retention job (CLI or background thread) that archives prompt logs older than N days to a tarball and truncates prompts.json accordingly, with config knobs and documentation.

tasks.title: Automate per-prompt git branching discipline
tasks.description: Nightshift currently documents git discipline but does not enforce it. Build automation so every prompt runs on its own branch off dev, merges only when instructed, and cleans up after itself.
tasks.prompt: Read ROADMAP.md for context. Implement the Section 0.1 branching discipline end-to-end: ensure the backend runner (and docs) always create a per-prompt nightshift/prompt-<id>-<slug> branch from dev, never touch main, enforce merges back into dev only when explicitly asked, and clean up local branches afterward. Update agents.md/README.md with the workflow, add configuration knobs, and include a smoke test or dry-run command. You are allowed to create follow-up tasks as needed - make sure to queue them if anything remains.
tasks.notes: git_branching.py + backend runner enforce branch discipline and docs were updated per ROADMAP 0.1.

tasks.title: Stand up the human tasks store + API
tasks.description: Phase 0.2 requires a persistent human task list and API so agents can register blockers. Ship the storage, backend endpoints, and logging glue.
tasks.prompt: Start by reading ROADMAP.md for reference. Implement the Human Tasks system described in Section 0.2: add a human_tasks.json (or similar) datastore, CRUD backend endpoints, persistence helpers, and agent-side affordances so blockers can be logged/retrieved. Update the UI or CLI to surface the queue, wire metrics into /api/health, and document usage. Feel free to create follow-up tasks if new work appears.
tasks.notes: backend/human_tasks.py store, API routes, CLI, and UI wiring now match ROADMAP 0.2 expectations.

tasks.title: Show Human Task stats on the auxiliary display
tasks.description: Phase 0.3 wants the auxiliary e-ink display to surface the Human Task queue. Hook it up once the store exists.
tasks.prompt: Review ROADMAP.md and the new Human Tasks API, then extend the auxiliary display updater to show the count of open/blocking human tasks and any urgent titles. Include configuration/documentation for refreshing, add a fallback when the API is empty, and queue follow-up tasks if more UX polish is needed.
tasks.notes: Aux display now mixes human tasks ahead of the prompt queue; see backend/eink/manager.py and backend/eink/renderer.py.

tasks.title: Bootstrap the CDK project skeleton
tasks.description: Create the cdk/ directory with a runnable AWS CDK app, pinned dependencies, and docs so infrastructure work can iterate.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 1.1) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Scaffold a cdk/ directory using AWS CDK (Python or TypeScript), add lockfiles and scripts to run `cdk synth/deploy`, and wire the stack to load instance/<name> context plus environment configuration. Provide README instructions, a smoke test/diff, and queue follow-up tasks if credentials or bootstrap steps are missing.
tasks.notes: cdk/app.py + config loader, example instance YAML, README updates, and scripts/cdk.sh now cover the bootstrap workflow.

tasks.title: Implement CDK compute + networking resources
tasks.description: Extend the CDK stack to provision the compute, storage, and network primitives Nightshift needs, parameterized by instance names.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 1.1) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Extend the CDK stack to create the Nightshift VPC, subnets, security groups, storage (EFS/S3), and compute layer (EC2 or containers) with outputs tied to instance/<name> parameters. Document the resources, integrate with scripts/deploy tooling, and ensure configuration/state flows back into Nightshift. Queue follow-up prompts or Human Tasks wherever approvals or secrets are required.
tasks.notes: cdk/nightshift_stack.py provisions VPC, networking, storage, and compute per Phase 1.1.

tasks.title: Containerize the backend/frontend with workspace mounts
tasks.description: Build Dockerfiles and compose tooling so Nightshift runs in containers with env-var configs and a /workspaces volume strategy.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 1.2–1.3) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Author multi-stage Dockerfiles for the backend and frontend, expose runtime configuration via env vars, and add a docker-compose (or similar) bundle that runs the API, workers, and auxiliary display. Implement the /workspaces volume plan so project repos mount predictably, add smoke tests, and document operator workflows. Queue follow-up prompts if additional runtime services or orchestration polish is needed.
tasks.notes: docker/ Dockerfiles plus compose + workspace mounts fulfill Phase 1.2-1.3.

tasks.title: Define structured project specifications
tasks.description: Phase 2.1 requires richer metadata for every onboarded project so the registry, environment tooling, and UI can reason about repos consistently.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.1) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Inventory the existing projects/* metadata, design a richer project specification schema (repo/source URLs, default branches, runtime/toolchain requirements, env vars/secrets, smoke tests, and operator contacts), and implement validation helpers so ProjectRegistry and /api/projects enforce it. Populate the new schema for all current projects, publish docs explaining how to add new specs, and capture migration/testing notes in logs/progress.log. Queue follow-up prompts or Human Tasks if additional repos need onboarding or if operators must supply secrets.

tasks.title: Build the shared environment registry + API
tasks.description: Phase 2.2 needs a persistent catalog of dev/test environments (per project, host, and status) exposed through the backend.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.2) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Design a data model (e.g., data/environments.json) to describe each environment's project, slug, host details, ports, health, owner, and lifecycle state, add backend modules + /api/environments CRUD endpoints, extend /api/health with aggregate stats, and provide a CLI helper for operators. Document how environment definitions tie back to the project specs, add regression tests, and queue follow-up prompts or Human Tasks for any infrastructure work (DNS, credentials, etc.) that must be handled manually.
tasks.notes: Environment registry landed with JSON schema, backend CRUD, CLI helper, and health metrics.

tasks.title: Expose environments via Traefik routing
tasks.description: Phase 2.3 calls for routing each registered environment through Traefik with predictable hostnames, TLS, and workspace mounts.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.3) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Using the environment registry, implement Traefik (or similar) config generation that maps each environment to hostnames/paths, wires TLS certs, and reloads when the registry changes. Update docker-compose/CDK tooling to run the router alongside Nightshift, document operator steps for certificates and DNS, and add smoke tests. Log the work in logs/progress.log and queue follow-up prompts or Human Tasks for manual certificate/DNS steps you cannot automate.
tasks.notes: Traefik service added to docker-compose/CDK, backend now generates dynamic config + docs/tests/log updates in place.

tasks.title: Surface environment data in the UI
tasks.description: Phase 2.4 needs the frontend to display project specs + environment states so operators can launch or debug hosts quickly.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading ROADMAP.md (Phase 2.4) and docs/upgrade_plan.json. Update the Vue/Vuetify frontend to consume the new project/environment APIs, render searchable tables/cards with status badges, quick-launch links, and integration points with the Human Tasks queue. Stream updates over WebSockets where possible, document UX changes, and add regression tests. Record the rollout in logs/progress.log and queue follow-up prompts if further UX polish or permissions work is required.

tasks.title: Plan the queue/workspace coexistence UX
tasks.description: Environment dashboards replaced the legacy landing page, and the prompt queue is no longer front-and-center. We need a clear plan for bringing the composer + chat thread back without losing the new workspace cards.
tasks.prompt: Start by re-reading the_project.txt, README.md, ROADMAP.md, agents.md, projects/nightshift/agents.md, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and logs/progress.log. Audit the current frontend (frontend/index.html) plus any queue-related backend APIs to document what regressed when the workspace/environment cards shipped. Produce a written plan that explains how the queue/composer/chat thread should share the screen with the workspace overview (layouts, toggles, sticky behaviour, streaming expectations). Update docs/upgrade_plan.json with any implementation follow-ups, document the findings in logs/progress.log, and queue the implementation prompt(s) you recommend.
tasks.notes: Audit captured three regressions from the workspace overview launch: (1) main-layout/chat columns still clamp the page to viewport height (frontend/index.html:102-177) so the new overview row (frontend/index.html:5235-5355) steals vertical space and hides the queue/composer, (2) mobile layouts have no way to toggle between overview vs. queue/thread so the cards bury the Task Queue, and (3) PromptStore.list_prompts (backend/server.py:1450-1470) still sorts by created_at DESC which now misleads operators that expect FIFO order beside the workspace data. Implementation will dock the overview cards beside the queue on desktop, add collapse/tabs for tablet + mobile, keep queue/composer sticky under the header, wire project/environments clicks into the queue filter, and spawn a dedicated backend ordering follow-up.

tasks.title: Deliver the restored Task Queue experience
tasks.description: Once the coexistence plan is in hand, implement the frontend/back-end tweaks so operators immediately see the queue/composer again while keeping the new workspace dashboard available.
tasks.prompt: Re-read the_project.txt, README.md, ROADMAP.md, agents.md, projects/nightshift/agents.md, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and the planning notes from restore-queue-ux-plan. Update frontend/index.html (and any supporting modules) so the Task Queue list, composer, and conversation thread remain visible without scrolling past the workspace cards, add responsive behaviours for mobile/desktop, and keep the real-time websocket stream+retry controls working. Ensure any backend API changes stay backward compatible, refresh docs/screenshots as needed, run the usual frontend/backend verifications (py_compile, lint, smoke tests), and summarize the rollout plus follow-ups in logs/progress.log.

tasks.title: Fix queue ordering & metadata for the workspace layout
tasks.description: Workspace cards pushed the Task Queue into a smaller viewport, so the API now needs explicit ordering + position metadata to avoid confusing operators.
tasks.prompt: Re-read the_project.txt, README.md, ROADMAP.md, agents.md, projects/nightshift/agents.md, docs/upgrade_plan.json, and the restore-queue-ux-plan notes. Update PromptStore.list_prompts plus the /api/prompts + WebSocket payloads so queue snapshots return queued prompts ordered by enqueued_at, running prompts ordered by started_at, and append terminal items afterward. Include a queue_position (FIFO index within queued/running) and explicit status buckets so the frontend can render badges without guessing. Keep backward compatibility for existing fields, document the schema changes, add tests for the ordering rules, refresh frontend/index.html to consume the new metadata, and summarize the rollout + verifications in logs/progress.log.

tasks.title: Provision DNS/TLS for Nebula Pulse preview
tasks.description: Create preview.nebulapulse.local + wildcard certs so the new preview environment can be exposed via Traefik.
tasks.prompt: Operators need to provision DNS records + TLS certificates for preview.nebulapulse.local and wire them into Traefik. Document the steps/logs once finished.

tasks.title: Sync credentials for refreshed Nightshift dev host
tasks.description: Ensure SSH keys + secrets referenced by data/environments.json exist on the Raspberry Pi host and operator vault.
tasks.prompt: Audit the secrets referenced in the environment registry (agent password, operator SSH keys, Traefik router creds) and update the operator vault / host files as needed.

tasks.title: Install TLS certs for the Nightshift dev router
tasks.description: Request/renew *.nightshift.local certificates, drop them into data/router/certs, and confirm Traefik serves HTTPS for nightshift-dev routes.
tasks.prompt: Operators must provision the certificates referenced by metadata.router.tls for env-nightshift-dev, copy them onto the host, and reload Traefik. Share thumbprints + DNS updates in #nightshift-ops.
